examples.correct: nimm einen Regenschirm mit

examples.wrong: Kochunfälle, wie unbeaufsichtigte Herdplatten.
examples.correct: Kochunfälle, zum Beispiel unbeaufsichtigte Herdplatten.

examples.wrong: Bei Rauch niedrig bleiben, um giftige Dämpfe zu vermeiden.
examples.correct: Bei Rauch in Bodennähe bleiben, um giftige Dämpfe zu vermeiden.

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent switching between informal ('du', 'dir') and formal ('Sie', 'Ihnen') forms, leading to inconsistent tone and register in educational content.

examples.wrong: Stell dir vor, du bist frustriert während eines Gruppenprojekts.
examples.correct: Stellen Sie sich vor, Sie sind frustriert während eines Gruppenprojekts.

examples.wrong: Wenn du vor einer Präsentation nervös bist, hilft dir Selbstwahrnehmung...
examples.correct: Wenn Sie vor einer Präsentation nervös sind, hilft Ihnen Selbstwahrnehmung...

examples.wrong: Während eines Gruppenprojekts helfen dir starke soziale Fähigkeiten...
examples.correct: Während eines Gruppenprojekts helfen Ihnen starke soziale Fähigkeiten...

top_error_patterns.description: Use of anglicisms, untranslated terms, or regionally specific words (e.g., 'Planer', 'LGBTQ+', 'DNA-Fingerprinting') can reduce clarity and cultural fit. Standard German terms and conventions should be used for inclusivity and comprehension.

examples.wrong: Voting Rights Act von 1965
examples.correct: Wahlrechtsgesetz von 1965 (Voting Rights Act)

examples.wrong: LGBTQ+-Personen
examples.correct: LSBTIQ+-Personen

examples.wrong: Planer verwenden
examples.correct: Kalender oder Terminplaner verwenden

top_error_patterns.description: Incorrect or non-standard technical terms are used, which can mislead learners and reduce the professionalism of educational content.

examples.wrong: Das erste Newtons Gesetz
examples.correct: Das erste Newtonsche Gesetz

examples.wrong: dynamische Typisierungssprache
examples.correct: dynamisch typisierte Sprache

examples.wrong: ausbalanciert
examples.correct: ausgleicht

top_error_patterns.description: Examples are often presented as fragments or standalone nouns, which can confuse learners. Full sentences that explicitly relate the example to the concept improve clarity and instructional quality.

examples.wrong: Ein Stück Pizza.
examples.correct: Ein Stück Pizza ist ein Beispiel für einen spitzen Winkel.

examples.wrong: Eine Uhr.
examples.correct: Eine Uhr ist ein Beispiel für einen Kreis.

examples.wrong: Mit einem sterilen Verband abdecken.
examples.correct: Die Wunde mit einem sterilen Verband abdecken.

top_error_patterns.description: Compound nouns are often incorrectly separated or lack required hyphens, which is against standard German orthographic rules and affects clarity.

examples.wrong: Montgomery Bus Boykott
examples.correct: Montgomery-Bus-Boykott

examples.wrong: Variable Zuweisung
examples.correct: Variablenzuweisung

examples.wrong: Drehmomentumübertragung
examples.correct: Drehmomentübertragung

examples.wrong: Bar/Bat Mitzwa
examples.correct: Bar/Bat Mizwa

top_error_patterns.description: Missing or incorrect use of articles (e.g., 'eine', 'ein') before nouns, which affects grammatical correctness and clarity in German sentences.

examples.wrong: Klare Kommunikation ist nicht notwendig für effektive Teamarbeit.
examples.correct: Klare Kommunikation ist nicht notwendig für eine effektive Teamarbeit.
examples.context: Missing article before a noun phrase.

examples.wrong: Emotionaler Appell ist ein wesentlicher Bestandteil, um die Perspektive des Autors zu unterstützen.
examples.correct: Ein emotionaler Appell ist ein wesentlicher Bestandteil, um die Perspektive des Autors zu unterstützen.
examples.context: Missing indefinite article before a noun.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of English loanwords or less precise terms where standard German terminology is preferred, reducing clarity and localization fit.

examples.wrong: Box
examples.correct: Kiste

examples.wrong: Skizzieren von Designs
examples.correct: Skizzieren von Designentwürfen
examples.context: Use of English plural instead of standard German term.

examples.wrong: manipulieren
examples.correct: verarbeiten
examples.context: Lexical choice with negative connotation in educational context.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Literal Translation of Idioms and Phrases
top_error_patterns.description: Direct translation of English idioms or phrases that sound awkward or unnatural in German, affecting clarity and engagement.

examples.wrong: klüger zu lesen, nicht härter
examples.correct: effizienter zu lesen

examples.wrong: Freundlichkeit wirkt wie ein Wellen-Effekt...
examples.correct: Freundlichkeit wirkt wie ein Dominoeffekt...

examples.wrong: von der Wissenschaft bis hin zur Alltagswissenschaft
examples.correct: von der Wissenschaft bis hin zum Alltag
examples.context: Describing the range from science to everyday life.

top_error_patterns.description: References or explanations that do not fit German cultural context or introduce unnecessary local information, causing confusion or reducing relevance.

examples.wrong: Sachbücher wie *National Geographic Kids*.
examples.correct: Sachbücher wie *Was ist Was*.

examples.wrong: In Deutschland ist die Anzahl der Senatoren nicht festgelegt...
examples.correct: Im Senat der Vereinigten Staaten hat jeder Bundesstaat genau zwei Senatoren...
examples.context: Explaining US government structure with unnecessary German comparison.

examples.wrong: St. Paul
examples.correct: Paulus
examples.context: Reference to the apostle in religious content.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of English-style formatting (e.g., phone numbers, abbreviations) or non-standard German abbreviations, reducing professionalism and local fit.

examples.wrong: Internationalen Pakt über bürgerliche und politische Rechte (IPbpR)
examples.correct: Internationaler Pakt über bürgerliche und politische Rechte (IPBPR)

top_error_patterns.description: Incorrect capitalization of adjectives or compound nouns, which affects orthographic accuracy and professional presentation.

examples.wrong: Tropische Klimazone
examples.correct: tropische Klimazone

examples.wrong: Klasse B Feuerlöscher
examples.correct: Klasse-B-Feuerlöscher

top_error_patterns.description: Awkward or repetitive sentence structures that reduce clarity and flow, such as unnecessary clauses or poor coordination.

examples.wrong: um genügend Schub zu erzeugen, um die Erdanziehung zu überwinden
examples.correct: um genügend Schub zu erzeugen, damit die Erdanziehung überwunden werden konnte

examples.wrong: Blindkonturzeichnung: ... konzentriert, nicht auf das Papier.
examples.correct: Blindkonturzeichnung: ... konzentriert und nicht auf das Papier.
examples.context: Missing coordinating conjunction for natural flow.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of masculine-only forms (e.g., 'Chemiker') or gender-specific terms ('Protagonistinnen') does not reflect current standards for inclusivity in German educational content. Corrections use gender-neutral or inclusive forms.

examples.wrong: Das Periodensystem ist wie eine Landkarte für Chemiker: Es zeigt alle bekannten Elemente und wie sie miteinander verbunden sind.
examples.correct: Das Periodensystem ist wie eine Landkarte für Chemikerinnen und Chemiker: Es zeigt alle bekannten Elemente und wie sie miteinander verbunden sind.

examples.wrong: Protagonistinnen
examples.correct: Hauptfiguren

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent use of Spanish loanwords or English false friends instead of correct Portuguese terms, leading to confusion and loss of professionalism.

examples.wrong: Encargado de criar e aprovar leis.
examples.correct: Responsável por criar e aprovar leis.
examples.context: Spanish loanword 'Encargado' used instead of Portuguese 'Responsável'.

examples.wrong: Cristianos acreditam em um único Deus...
examples.correct: Cristãos acreditam em um único Deus...

examples.wrong: sites faladores
examples.correct: sites falsos

top_error_patterns.description: Systematic mistakes in matching articles, adjectives, and participles to the gender and number of nouns, affecting clarity and grammatical correctness.

examples.wrong: pelos mitocôndrias
examples.correct: pelas mitocôndrias
examples.context: Incorrect masculine article with feminine plural noun.

examples.wrong: nos mensagens
examples.correct: nas mensagens
examples.context: Masculine article used with feminine noun.

examples.wrong: A plasma é o estado da matéria...
examples.correct: O plasma é o estado da matéria...

top_error_patterns.description: Incorrect terminology or factual errors in scientific contexts, leading to misinformation and misunderstanding of key concepts.

examples.wrong: O retículo endoplasmático liso... elaboração de proteínas...
examples.correct: O retículo endoplasmático liso... elaboração de lipídios...

examples.wrong: A zona tropical... temperaturas são extremamente baixas.
examples.correct: A zona tropical... temperaturas são extremamente altas.

examples.wrong: Quanto maior a inclinação... menos força é necessária...
examples.correct: Quanto menor a inclinação... menos força é necessária...

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent errors in the use of prepositions and crase, especially in scientific and literary contexts, affecting idiomaticity and clarity.

examples.wrong: adenina se conecta com timina
examples.correct: adenina se conecta à timina

examples.wrong: Personagens não se limitam à personagens principais
examples.correct: Personagens não se limitam a personagens principais
examples.context: Incorrect use of crase before plural noun.

top_error_patterns.description: Mixing English words or incorrect syntactic structures in Portuguese sentences, disrupting comprehension and natural flow.

examples.wrong: they são o combustível...
examples.correct: eles são o combustível...
examples.context: English pronoun used in Portuguese sentence.

examples.wrong: A eletronegatividade... em uma coluna...
examples.correct: A eletronegatividade... em um período...

top_error_patterns.description: Statements that misrepresent cultural or educational practices in Brazil, leading to misleading or incorrect information for the target audience.

examples.wrong: Embora textos de ficção possam ser interessantes e envolventes, eles são principalmente criados para entretenimento e não para fins educacionais.
examples.correct: Embora textos de ficção sejam geralmente criados para entretenimento, eles também podem ser usados para fins educacionais, como estimular a criatividade, promover a empatia ou ilustrar conceitos em sala de aula.
examples.context: Misrepresentation of the educational use of fiction in Brazilian schools.

examples.wrong: A participação cívica é uma atividade que só é realizada em dias de feriado nacional.
examples.correct: A participação cívica é uma atividade que pode ser realizada em qualquer dia, não apenas em feriados nacionais.
examples.context: Incorrectly limiting civic participation to national holidays, ignoring its ongoing nature in Brazilian society.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of imperial units (feet) instead of metric units (meter), which are standard in Brazil, causing confusion and reducing clarity.

examples.wrong: Mantenha aquecedores a pelo menos três pés de distância de objetos inflamáveis.
examples.correct: Mantenha aquecedores a pelo menos um metro de distância de objetos inflamáveis.
examples.context: Distance measurements in safety instructions use non-standard units for the Brazilian audience.

top_error_patterns.description: Failure to translate important English terms into their standard Portuguese equivalents, reducing comprehension and professionalism.

examples.wrong: checks and balances
examples.correct: sistema de freios e contrapesos
examples.context: Political science terminology left untranslated, hindering understanding in educational content.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Inappropriate Use of Emojis in Formal Educational Content
top_error_patterns.description: Emojis are frequently used in educational texts, but they are considered informal and unprofessional in Brazilian Portuguese academic contexts. Their removal improves tone and cultural fit.

examples.wrong: Bem-vindos ao fascinante mundo do Egito Antigo! ✨
examples.correct: Bem-vindos ao fascinante mundo do Egito Antigo!

examples.wrong: Essas técnicas irão ajudá-lo a analisar textos com confiança e eficiência. 📚
examples.correct: Essas técnicas irão ajudá-lo a analisar textos com confiança e eficiência.

examples.wrong: Vamos explorar juntos a história, os desafios e as tecnologias que moldaram a exploração espacial, conectando esses conceitos aos princípios científicos do movimento orbital. 🚀
examples.correct: Vamos explorar juntos a história, os desafios e as tecnologias que moldaram a exploração espacial, conectando esses conceitos aos princípios científicos do movimento orbital.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of words or expressions that are literal translations, anglicisms, or regionally inappropriate, resulting in unnatural or imprecise language for Brazilian Portuguese educational content.

examples.wrong: A membrana celular é bastante selectiva na sua permissividade.
examples.correct: A membrana celular é bastante seletiva na sua permissividade.
examples.context: European Portuguese spelling instead of Brazilian Portuguese.

examples.wrong: estações eleitorais
examples.correct: locais de votação
examples.context: Literal translation of 'polling stations' instead of the standard term.

examples.wrong: advocacia por questões importantes
examples.correct: defesa de questões importantes
examples.context: False friend; 'advocacia' refers to the legal profession.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of English terms or non-standard translations instead of locally accepted Brazilian Portuguese terminology, reducing clarity and professionalism.

examples.wrong: Cyberbullying
examples.correct: Ciberbullying

examples.wrong: feedbacks
examples.correct: retornos
examples.context: Instructions for peer review or feedback

examples.wrong: Cornell Notes
examples.correct: método Cornell

top_error_patterns.description: Terms are used that do not align with Brazilian Portuguese conventions, such as direct translations, anglicisms, or less formal words, reducing clarity and professionalism.

examples.wrong: semi-conservativa
examples.correct: semiconservativa

examples.wrong: Chatbots oferecem suporte rápido ao cliente.
examples.correct: Assistentes virtuais oferecem suporte rápido ao cliente.

examples.wrong: pré-visualização do texto
examples.correct: prévia do texto

top_error_patterns.description: Phrases are constructed in ways that are grammatically correct but sound unnatural or less idiomatic in Brazilian Portuguese, affecting readability and engagement.

examples.wrong: misturar com o entorno
examples.correct: misturar ao ambiente

examples.wrong: Você não é adulto.
examples.correct: Você ainda não é adulto.

examples.wrong: Métodos incluem o uso de ferramentas...
examples.correct: As técnicas incluem o uso de ferramentas...

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect use of definite articles and prepositions
top_error_patterns.description: Frequent omission or misuse of definite articles ('o', 'a', 'os', 'as') and prepositions (including crase) in noun phrases and verb constructions, leading to grammatical inaccuracies and reduced clarity.

examples.wrong: A localização do Egito conectava-o a outras regiões, promovendo comércio e intercâmbio cultural.
examples.correct: A localização do Egito conectava-o a outras regiões, promovendo o comércio e o intercâmbio cultural.
examples.context: Omission of articles before nouns in educational explanations.

examples.wrong: Trabalhem juntos para achar opções que atendam todos.
examples.correct: Trabalhem juntos para achar opções que atendam a todos.
examples.context: Missing preposition required by the verb 'atender'.

examples.wrong: Este comportamento é um exemplo de bondade diária que pode ser facilmente incorporado na rotina diária de alguém.
examples.correct: Este comportamento é um exemplo de bondade diária que pode ser facilmente incorporado à rotina diária de alguém.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of phrases or constructions that are grammatically correct but not idiomatic or clear in Brazilian Portuguese, affecting the naturalness and comprehension of educational material.

examples.wrong: Pressione forte e rápido, 100-120 compressões por minuto.
examples.correct: Pressione com força e rapidez, 100-120 compressões por minuto.

examples.wrong: Plano de evacuação: Crie e pratique um plano de fuga familiar com duas saídas de cada cômodo.
examples.correct: Plano de evacuação: Crie e pratique um plano de fuga para a família com duas saídas de cada cômodo.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of words or expressions that are grammatically correct but not idiomatic or precise in Brazilian Portuguese, affecting clarity and professionalism.

examples.wrong: Ratos-canguru que sobrevivem sem beber água...
examples.correct: Ratos-canguru que sobrevivem sem ingerir água...

examples.wrong: habilidades sociais fortes
examples.correct: habilidades sociais sólidas
examples.context: Describing social skills in group work

top_error_patterns.description: Mistakes in matching gender and number between nouns, adjectives, and verbs, which can confuse learners and reduce the professionalism of the content.

examples.wrong: Strings podem ser armazenados como números.
examples.correct: Strings podem ser armazenadas como números.
examples.context: Incorrect gender agreement with the noun 'strings'.

examples.wrong: compartilhar tal dados pessoal
examples.correct: compartilhar tais dados pessoais
examples.context: Mismatch in number and gender in noun phrase.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect sentence type for Yes/No questions
top_error_patterns.description: Statements are used instead of questions in Yes/No quiz items, missing the question mark and proper interrogative structure.

examples.wrong: O numerador pode ser maior que o denominador em uma fração.
examples.correct: O numerador pode ser maior que o denominador em uma fração?
examples.context: Yes/No question context in math quizzes

examples.wrong: Toda fração é maior que um todo.
examples.correct: Toda fração é maior que um todo?
examples.context: Yes/No question context in math quizzes

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Grammatical agreement and article usage errors
top_error_patterns.description: Omission or incorrect use of definite articles, verb conjugation mismatches, and number agreement errors that affect sentence correctness.

examples.wrong: Desperdício de materiais e energia não tem impacto...
examples.correct: O desperdício de materiais e energia não tem impacto...

examples.wrong: Exemplos incluem mastros de bandeira...
examples.correct: Exemplos incluem mastros de bandeiras...

examples.wrong: Por exemplo, enquanto mercados emergentes como China e Índia prosperam...
examples.correct: Por exemplo, enquanto mercados emergentes como a China e a Índia prosperam...
examples.context: Missing definite articles before country names

top_error_patterns.description: Spelling mistakes and use of European Portuguese variants instead of Brazilian Portuguese, which can distract learners and reduce localization quality.

examples.wrong: prototipos
examples.correct: protótipos
examples.context: Missing accent in a scientific term.

examples.wrong: Percentagens
examples.correct: Porcentagens
examples.context: European Portuguese variant instead of Brazilian Portuguese.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Cultural References Not Adapted for Brazilian Context
top_error_patterns.description: Examples, anecdotes, or references that are US-centric or globally generic, rather than locally relevant, reducing relatability and engagement for Brazilian students.

examples.wrong: Exemplos incluem os Estados Unidos importando eletrônicos da China e exportando produtos agrícolas como trigo e milho...
examples.correct: Exemplos incluem o Brasil importando eletrônicos da China e exportando produtos agrícolas como soja e café...

examples.wrong: Michael Jordan, considerado um dos maiores jogadores de basquete de todos os tempos...
examples.correct: Use a Brazilian sports figure or provide more context.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of general or imprecise terms instead of standard scientific or technical vocabulary, affecting accuracy and comprehension.

examples.wrong: segmento de linha
examples.correct: segmento de reta

examples.wrong: forma de matéria
examples.correct: estado da matéria

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect or Unnatural Imperative and Instructional Style
top_error_patterns.description: Use of impersonal or singular imperative forms in instructions where plural or direct forms are more natural and engaging for Brazilian learners.

examples.wrong: Evitar escrever em CAIXA ALTA, que pode parecer gritar.
examples.correct: Evite escrever em CAIXA ALTA, pois isso pode ser interpretado como grito.

examples.wrong: Trabalhe juntos para encontrar soluções.
examples.correct: Trabalhem juntos para encontrar soluções.

top_error_patterns.description: References to foreign currency or formats that do not match Brazilian standards, reducing cultural fit and comprehension.

examples.wrong: Uma moeda de 25 centavos vale 1/4 de um dólar.
examples.correct: Uma moeda de 25 centavos vale 1/4 de um real.

top_error_patterns.description: The abbreviation 'Ex.:' is repeatedly used instead of the standard 'Exemplo:' in Brazilian Portuguese educational materials, affecting clarity and professionalism.

examples.wrong: Ex.: pão, arroz, frutas.
examples.correct: Exemplo: pão, arroz, frutas.

examples.wrong: Ex.: arroz, macarrão
examples.correct: Exemplo: arroz, macarrão

examples.wrong: Ex.: espinafre, maçãs
examples.correct: Exemplo: espinafre, maçãs

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect or missing punctuation and capitalization
top_error_patterns.description: Minor errors such as missing commas, unnecessary exclamation marks, incorrect capitalization at sentence start, or improper use of hyphens.

examples.wrong: O número `5` na equação `x + 5 = 10` é de fato uma constante...
examples.correct: O número `5` na equação `x + 5 = 10` é, de fato, uma constante...

examples.wrong: raios-X
examples.correct: raios X
examples.context: Compound noun spelling in science content

examples.wrong: a Torá é o texto sagrado...
examples.correct: A Torá é o texto sagrado...
examples.context: Capitalization at start of bullet point

top_error_patterns.description: Use of adjectives instead of adverbs in formal educational contexts, reducing grammatical precision.

examples.wrong: crescem mais rápido do que em áreas sombreadas
examples.correct: crescem mais rapidamente do que em áreas sombreadas
examples.context: Describing growth rates in science content

examples.wrong: crescem mais rápido foi confirmada...
examples.correct: crescem mais rapidamente foi confirmada...

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Non-Localized Formatting of Numbers and Dates
top_error_patterns.description: Formatting conventions for numbers and date ranges follow English standards rather than Brazilian Portuguese, which can cause confusion or reduce cultural fit.

examples.wrong: século V–IV a.C.
examples.correct: século V a IV a.C.

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent use of half-width periods ('.'), double periods, or unnecessary Western punctuation at the end of Japanese sentences, which disrupts readability and violates Japanese orthographic conventions.

examples.wrong: ナイル川はエジプトの生涯にわたる経済発展の重要な要因でした.
examples.correct: ナイル川はエジプトの長きにわたる経済発展の重要な要因でした。
examples.context: Sentence ends with half-width period instead of Japanese full stop.

examples.wrong: 感情は私たちが自然に経験するものです。異なる人々は異なる感情を持つことがありますが、感情自体は全員が経験するものではありません。...
examples.correct: 感情は私たちが自然に経験するものです。異なる人々は異なる感情を持つことがありますが、感情自体は全員が経験するものです。

examples.wrong: 儿童は自分の感情を完全に理解することができます。.
examples.correct: 子どもは自分の感情を完全に理解することができます。
examples.context: Half-width period after Japanese full stop.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Lexical errors and unnatural word choices
top_error_patterns.description: Use of non-standard, incorrect, or unnatural words and phrases that are not appropriate in Japanese, leading to confusion or misinterpretation.

examples.wrong: 冷却帯の温度は非常に高いため、生物多様性が豊かです。
examples.correct: 極地気候帯の温度は非常に低いため、生物多様性は限られています。

examples.wrong: 冷革な対話が続きます。
examples.correct: 冷静な対話が続きます。
examples.context: Non-existent word '冷革' instead of '冷静'.

examples.wrong: 物語の中心的なアイデアは物語の説得力としかりみです。
examples.correct: 物語の中心的なアイデアは物語の説得力と魅力です。
examples.context: Typographical error 'しかりみ' instead of '魅力'.

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent use of incorrect grammatical structures, negative forms, or logical contradictions that obscure meaning and reduce clarity.

examples.wrong: 三角形には頂点が3つすべてではありません。
examples.correct: 三角形には必ず3つの頂点があります。
examples.context: Logical contradiction and incorrect negative construction.

examples.wrong: オンラインで共有される情報は必ずしも重要です。.
examples.correct: オンラインで共有される情報は必ずしも重要ではありません。

examples.wrong: 族は同じ族に属する元素の数の電子が同じであることによって決まります。.
examples.correct: 族は同じ族に属する元素の外殻電子の数が同じであることによって決まります。

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Use of non-Japanese or corrupted characters
top_error_patterns.description: Presence of Chinese terms, corrupted text, or incomplete words due to encoding errors, which severely impact comprehension and professionalism.

examples.wrong: 儿童は自分の感情を完全に理解することができます。.
examples.correct: 子どもは自分の感情を完全に理解することができます。
examples.context: Chinese term '儿童' instead of Japanese '子ども'.

examples.wrong: 強力なパスワードは短く簡����antoいすることが推奨されます。.
examples.correct: 強力なパスワードは短く簡単にすることが推奨されます。

examples.wrong: アメリカの選挙は公開され、市民が自由に参加することができる民主的なプロセスです。この誤解を解消するために、選挙はどのような民主主義の基礎であるかを考えてみてくだ�。
examples.correct: アメリカの選挙は公開され、市民が自由に参加することができる民主的なプロセスです。この誤解を解消するために、選挙はどのような民主主義の基礎であるかを考えてみてください。
examples.context: Incomplete word due to encoding error.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of incorrect scientific terms or factual errors that misrepresent key concepts, affecting educational accuracy and learner trust.

examples.wrong: 原子構成は元素の酸素電子数によって決定されます。.
examples.correct: 原子構成は元素の原子番号によって決定されます。
examples.context: Non-standard term '酸素電子数' instead of '原子番号'.

examples.wrong: 核電荷が周期によって減少する.
examples.correct: 核電荷は周期によって増加する。

top_error_patterns.description: Use of terms that misrepresent key concepts, leading to factual inaccuracies and confusion for learners.

examples.wrong: ノンフィクション書は、歴史上の人物の生活についての創作物です。
examples.correct: ノンフィクション書は、歴史上の人物の生活についての創作物ではありません。
examples.context: Definition of non-fiction misrepresented, causing misunderstanding of genre distinctions.

top_error_patterns.description: Selection of words that are culturally inappropriate or unnatural in educational contexts, reducing clarity and professionalism.

examples.wrong: 記憶の力を最大限に活用する秘謀です。
examples.correct: 記憶の力を最大限に活用する方法です。
examples.context: Use of '秘謀' (secret plot) instead of '方法' (method) in instructional content.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Sentence ends with both Japanese full stop (。) and half-width period (.)
top_error_patterns.description: Sentences frequently end with a Japanese full stop (。) immediately followed by a half-width period (.), resulting in double punctuation. This is not standard in Japanese writing and affects professionalism and readability.

examples.wrong: 古代エジプトではファラオの権力が絶えず変わり、各ファラオは建築に大きな貢納を求めませんでした.
examples.correct: 古代エジプトではファラオの権力が絶えず変わり、各ファラオは建築に大きな貢納を求めませんでした。

examples.wrong: 感情は私たちの経験に影響を与える。.
examples.correct: 感情は私たちの経験に影響を与える。

examples.wrong: 科学的手法は主に芸術的なスキルの発展を目指すために使われます。.
examples.correct: 科学的手法は主に芸術的なスキルの発展を目指すために使われます。

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Sentence ends with half-width period (.) instead of full-width Japanese period (。)
top_error_patterns.description: Sentences end with a half-width period (.) rather than the standard Japanese full-width period (。), which is incorrect in Japanese writing and affects the naturalness and correctness of the text.

examples.wrong: 感情知能を持つ人は、自分の感情や他人の感情のニュアンスをより深く理解することができる.
examples.correct: 感情知能を持つ人は、自分の感情や他人の感情のニュアンスをより深く理解することができる。

examples.wrong: 困難な課題を避けることが成長にとって最も有益である.
examples.correct: 困難な課題を避けることが成長にとって最も有益である。

examples.wrong: イオン推進システムは化学ロケットよりも速い速度で宇宙に到達できます.
examples.correct: イオン推進システムは化学ロケットよりも速い速度で宇宙に到達できます。

top_error_patterns.description: Use of kanji or terms that are incorrect or unnatural in Japanese, often due to direct translation or confusion with similar Chinese characters.

examples.wrong: 資源が豊富な地域は経済が繁荣することが一般的です。.
examples.correct: 資源が豊富な地域は経済が繁栄することが一般的です。
examples.context: Incorrect kanji '繁荣' used instead of '繁栄'; also contains mixed punctuation.

examples.wrong: グローバル貿易は経済成長を消減させることがあります。
examples.correct: グローバル貿易は経済成長を減少させることがあります。
examples.context: Non-standard term '消減' used instead of the natural '減少'.

top_error_patterns.description: Sentences end with both Japanese and Western periods, or contain unnecessary punctuation, which disrupts readability and professionalism.

examples.wrong: 資源が豊富な地域は経済が繁荣することが一般的です。.
examples.correct: 資源が豊富な地域は経済が繁栄することが一般的です。
examples.context: Ends with both Japanese full stop and English period.

examples.wrong: その通りです。感情は私たちの経験、たとえそれが短期間であっても長期間もあります。喜びや悲しみ、怒りなど、感情は私たちの行動や考え方に影響を与え、人間関係において重要な役割を果たします。.
examples.correct: その通りです。感情は私たちの経験、たとえそれが短期間であっても長期間であってもあります。喜びや悲しみ、怒りなど、感情は私たちの行動や考え方に影響を与え、人間関係において重要な役割を果たします。

top_error_patterns.description: Use of verb forms that are grammatically incorrect or unnatural in Japanese, affecting clarity and flow.

examples.wrong: イデーションは困難を探しているプロセスです。
examples.correct: イデーションは困難を探すプロセスです。
examples.context: Continuous verb form '探している' used instead of the more appropriate '探す'.

examples.wrong: 記憶術は、覚えやすいものや既知のものに情報を関連付けることで記憶を助けるツールです。
examples.correct: 記憶術は、覚えやすいものや既知のものに情報を関連付けて記憶を助ける方法です。
examples.context: Verb phrase and noun choice ('ツール' vs '方法') are unnatural for educational context.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Unnatural lexical choices or direct loan translations
top_error_patterns.description: Use of words or phrases that are direct translations from English or otherwise unnatural in Japanese, reducing clarity and localization fit.

examples.wrong: これは、相互作用がフィールドが異なる可能性があるためです。
examples.correct: これは、相互作用する相手の背景が異なる可能性があるためです。
examples.context: Direct loan 'フィールド' used instead of natural '背景'.

examples.wrong: デジタルエチケットは、私がオンラインで見せる外見が全ての世界で受け取られるという考えに基づいていません。
examples.correct: デジタルエチケットは、私がオンラインで見せる外見が全ての世界で受け入れられるという考えに基づいていません。
examples.context: Incorrect verb '受け取られる' used instead of '受け入れられる'.

top_error_patterns.description: Sentences contain awkward phrasing or incorrect particle usage, making them difficult to understand or less idiomatic.

examples.wrong: この私たちの食事には、炭水化物をサラダやご飯に、タンパク質を鶏肉や豆腐に、脂質をオリーブオイルやナッツにとることで摂取する食材が含まれています。
examples.correct: 私たちの食事には、サラダやご飯から炭水化物、鶏肉や豆腐からタンパク質、オリーブオイルやナッツから脂質を摂取する食材が含まれています。
examples.context: Unnatural phrasing and incorrect particle usage for nutrient sources.

examples.wrong: 陰影の技法には、光源の位置が関係ない。
examples.correct: 陰影の技法には、光源の位置が関係ありません。
examples.context: Plain negative form used instead of polite form, affecting tone and register.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of backticks and asterisks for math expressions is not standard in Japanese educational content. Proper formatting uses plain numbers/variables and the multiplication sign (×).

examples.wrong:
シャツ一枚の値段が`20`円で、3枚購入すると合計費用は:
- `x = 20`（シャツ1枚の値段）  
- 合計 = `3 * x = 3 * 20 = 60`円
examples.correct:
シャツ一枚の値段が20円で、3枚購入すると合計費用は:
- x = 20（シャツ1枚の値段）
- 合計 = 3 × x = 3 × 20 = 60円

top_error_patterns.description: Direct translations about copyright (e.g., gratitude and payment for permission) are unnatural and may mislead learners. Standard Japanese uses '許可を得るべきです' for clarity.

examples.wrong: オリジナルの作品の著作者に感謝と支払いの形で承認を得るべきです。
examples.correct: オリジナルの作品の著作者から許可を得るべきです。

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Misleading or unclear terminology for genre definitions
top_error_patterns.description: Genre definitions (e.g., non-fiction) use ambiguous or informal phrasing. Polite, clear forms are preferred for educational clarity.

examples.wrong: ノンフィクションは完全に架空の世界ではない。
examples.correct: ノンフィクションは完全に架空の世界ではありません。

top_error_patterns.description: Directly translated scientific phrases (e.g., '証拠を提供します') are less natural in Japanese. Use '示しています' for clearer, culturally appropriate explanations.

examples.wrong: これらの記憶テクニックは脳の構造が認知機能をサポートする証拠を提供します。
examples.correct: これらの記憶テクニックは脳の構造が認知機能を支えることを示しています。

top_error_patterns.description: Use of US-style phone numbers is inappropriate for Japanese learners. Japanese phone number formats should be used for cultural relevance.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Sentence ends with two consecutive full-width periods (..)
top_error_patterns.description: Sentences end with two consecutive full-width periods (..), which is not standard in Japanese and can distract readers. Only one full-width period should be used.

examples.wrong: 三角形の種類について学んでいるところなので、正三角形という名前が指しているのは、その特徴である3つの等しい辺についてのことです..
examples.correct: 三角形の種類について学んでいるところなので、正三角形という名前が指しているのは、その特徴である3つの等しい辺についてのことです。

examples.wrong: 固定マインドセットは、自分の能力が固定されていると考え、挑戦や障害に直面することを避けがちです。この認識は、個人が新しいスキルを学び、成長する機会を見過ごす可能性があります..
examples.correct: 固定マインドセットは、自分の能力が固定されていると考え、挑戦や障害に直面することを避けがちです。この認識は、個人が新しいスキルを学び、成長する機会を見過ごす可能性があります。

examples.wrong: ニュートンの万有引力の法則は、物体間の距離が変わると引力が変動することを考慮しています。地球から離れるために必要な速度は、距離が着実に減少するにつれて確実に減少します..
examples.correct: ニュートンの万有引力の法則は、物体間の距離が変わると引力が変動することを考慮しています。地球から離れるために必要な速度は、距離が着実に減少するにつれて確実に減少します。

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Unnecessary comma (、) after topic marker or at start of sentence
top_error_patterns.description: Commas (、) are placed after the topic marker 'は' or at the start of sentences, which is unnecessary in Japanese and disrupts the natural flow. This is a minor orthographic issue.

examples.wrong: 人権は、すべての人に平等に与えられる基本的な権利です。
examples.correct: 人権はすべての人に平等に与えられる基本的な権利です。

examples.wrong: 例えば、エレノア・ルーズベルトは、世界人権宣言を「すべての人々と国々のための共通の達成基準」と表現しました。
examples.correct: 例えばエレノア・ルーズベルトは世界人権宣言を「すべての人々と国々のための共通の達成基準」と表現しました。

examples.wrong: 世界人権宣言は、戦争の恐怖や抑圧が再び起こることを防ぐために作成されました。
examples.correct: 世界人権宣言は戦争の恐怖や抑圧が再び起こることを防ぐために作成されました。

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Emoji or informal symbol at end of educational sentence
top_error_patterns.description: Use of emoji (e.g., 🌱) at the end of formal educational content is not standard and can affect the professional tone. Emojis should be avoided unless pedagogically justified.

examples.wrong: 生命の基本を理解するための重要なステップです！ 🌱
examples.correct: 生命の基本を理解するための重要なステップです！

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Inappropriate Use of Emojis in Formal Contexts
top_error_patterns.description: Emojis such as '🌏' are used in educational content, which can undermine the professional tone expected in formal Japanese materials.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Unnatural Loanword Usage for Educational Terminology
top_error_patterns.description: Loanwords like 'メカニズム' are used where more natural Japanese terms such as '仕組み' would improve clarity and fit for educational content.

examples.wrong: 記憶の保存を強化するメカニズムです。
examples.correct: 記憶の定着を強化する仕組みです。
examples.context: Explanations of scientific or educational concepts

top_error_patterns.description: Colons are added after headings or phrases where no list or explanation directly follows, leading to minor formatting inconsistencies.

examples.wrong: Key takeaways:
examples.correct: Key takeaways
examples.context: Appears before a set of points not formatted as a list.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Omission of Definite Articles in Phrases
top_error_patterns.description: Definite articles such as 'the' are omitted before noun phrases, resulting in less natural or incomplete English expressions.

examples.wrong: - importance of healthy eating
examples.correct: - The importance of healthy eating
examples.context: Appears in bullet points summarizing key concepts.

top_error_patterns.description: Phrases use literal or awkward translations instead of natural Spanish expressions, reducing fluency.

examples.wrong: Necesitas 1.5 huevos.
examples.correct: Necesitas 1 huevo y medio.

examples.wrong: Platos indulgentes como la feijoada en Brasil y pasteles de rey en Europa.
examples.correct: Platos indulgentes como la feijoada en Brasil y el roscón de reyes en Europa.

examples.wrong: En caso de quemaduras graves, busca atención médica inmediata.
examples.correct: En caso de quemaduras graves, busca atención médica de inmediato.

examples.wrong: "Me siento triste cuando no siento que me escuchan."
examples.correct: "Me siento triste cuando siento que no me escuchan."

examples.wrong: En ciencias e ingeniería...
examples.correct: En ciencia e ingeniería...

examples.wrong: Marcar elecciones en la boleta...
examples.correct: Marcar las opciones en la boleta...

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect capitalization of poetic form names
top_error_patterns.description: Poetic form names are incorrectly capitalized in Spanish; they should be lowercase unless at the start of a sentence.

examples.wrong: El Haiku es una forma de poesía...
examples.correct: El haiku es una forma de poesía...
examples.context: Names of poetic forms in explanations

examples.wrong: El Soneto
examples.correct: El soneto

examples.wrong: El Verso Libre
examples.correct: El verso libre

examples.wrong: La Villanelle
examples.correct: La villanela

top_error_patterns.description: Specialized terms and borrowed words are misspelled, affecting clarity and professionalism.

examples.wrong: grafiti
examples.correct: graffiti

examples.wrong: Shakespeareano
examples.correct: Shakespeariano

examples.wrong: Petrarchano
examples.correct: Petrarquiano

examples.wrong: Splash
examples.correct: ¡Splash!

top_error_patterns.description: The English term 'mnemonics' is used instead of the correct Spanish equivalent 'mnemotécnicos', affecting clarity and localization fit.

examples.wrong: Los mnemonics son herramientas que nos ayudan a recordar información...
examples.correct: Los mnemotécnicos son herramientas que nos ayudan a recordar información...
examples.context: Definition and description of memory aids

examples.wrong: Los mnemonics simplifican información compleja...
examples.correct: Los mnemotécnicos simplifican información compleja...
examples.context: Explanation of how memory aids work

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Agreement errors in pronouns and adjectives
top_error_patterns.description: Mistakes in singular/plural agreement for pronouns and adjectives, leading to grammatical inaccuracies and reduced clarity.

examples.wrong: Su grueso pelaje y capa de grasa los mantienen calientes en el Ártico.
examples.correct: Su grueso pelaje y capa de grasa lo mantienen caliente en el Ártico.
examples.context: Describing how features keep an animal warm

examples.wrong: Visualización: Hacerlo Memorables
examples.correct: Visualización: Hacerlo Memorable

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect use of English terms instead of Spanish equivalents
top_error_patterns.description: Use of English spelling for specialized terms instead of the Spanish equivalent, which can hinder comprehension and localization.

examples.wrong: Villanelle
examples.correct: Villanela
examples.context: Naming poetic forms in quiz content

top_error_patterns.description: Use of a past participle ('basada') instead of the correct reflexive gerund ('basándote'), affecting clarity of instructions.

examples.wrong: Decide si tu hipótesis fue correcta basada en la evidencia.
examples.correct: Decide si tu hipótesis fue correcta basándote en la evidencia.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Missing or incorrect punctuation in lists and interjections
top_error_patterns.description: Lists lack necessary commas and interjections miss Spanish-specific punctuation, slightly affecting clarity.

examples.wrong: relaciones entre puntos líneas y ángulos
examples.correct: relaciones entre puntos, líneas y ángulos

examples.wrong: Población limitada; estaciones de investigación y pesca pequeña escala.
examples.correct: Población limitada; estaciones de investigación y pesca a pequeña escala.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Missing articles for gender and number agreement
top_error_patterns.description: Items in a list lack definite articles, leading to minor agreement errors.

examples.wrong: Los seis tipos son la palanca, rueda y eje, polea, plano inclinado, cuña y tornillo...
examples.correct: Los seis tipos son la palanca, la rueda y el eje, la polea, el plano inclinado, la cuña y el tornillo...

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent use of unnatural, awkward, or non-idiomatic phrases that reduce clarity and professional tone. More precise or standard terms are available in Polish.

examples.wrong: wsparcie dla rolnictwa
examples.correct: sprzyjające warunki dla rolnictwa
examples.context: Geographical description; 'wsparcie' is not idiomatic in this context.

examples.wrong: łazik Marsa
examples.correct: łazik marsjański
examples.context: Scientific terminology; standard term for Mars rover.

examples.wrong: gaz w neonówce
examples.correct: gaz w lampie neonowej
examples.context: Colloquial vs. formal register in educational content.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect word choice for technical or scientific terms
top_error_patterns.description: Recurring misuse of technical or scientific terminology, leading to confusion or imprecise meaning in educational contexts.

examples.wrong: punkt podparcia
examples.correct: punkt oparcia
examples.context: Referring to the fulcrum in physics lessons.

examples.wrong: pręt obracający się wokół stałego punktu, zwanego punktem podparcia
examples.correct: pręt obracający się wokół stałego punktu, zwanego punktem oparcia

examples.wrong: Stan wysokiej energii, w którym cząsteczki są zjonizowane (naładowane).
examples.correct: Stan wysokiej energii, w którym cząstki są zjonizowane (naładowane).
examples.context: Explaining plasma state in science content.

examples.wrong: na cichej postawie
examples.correct: w cichej postawie
examples.context: Describing a state or attitude in Polish.

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent errors in case selection and agreement, affecting clarity and grammatical correctness.

examples.wrong: W tym lekcji dowiesz się...
examples.correct: W tej lekcji dowiesz się...

examples.wrong: Obywatele muszą się zarejestrować, aby potwierdzić swoją uprawnienia...
examples.correct: Obywatele muszą się zarejestrować, aby potwierdzić swoje uprawnienia...
examples.context: Possessive pronoun must agree with plural noun.

examples.wrong: Każdy rzut ma równą szansę na wylądowanie na orła lub reszki...
examples.correct: Każdy rzut ma równą szansę na wylądowanie na orle lub reszce...
examples.context: Locative case after 'na' with static meaning.

top_error_patterns.description: Mistakes in verb aspect or tense, leading to unnatural or incorrect phrasing.

examples.wrong: To pomoże Ci nie tylko lepiej zrozumieć informacje, ale także rozwijać umiejętności krytycznego myślenia!
examples.correct: To pomoże Ci nie tylko lepiej zrozumieć informacje, ale także rozwinąć umiejętności krytycznego myślenia!

examples.wrong: AI przewidujące zmiany środowiskowe i testujące rozwiązania...
examples.correct: AI przewiduje zmiany środowiskowe i testuje rozwiązania...

top_error_patterns.description: Mistakes in gender agreement between nouns and adjectives or participles, affecting grammatical correctness.

examples.wrong: Nala odgrywa rolę wspierającą.
examples.correct: Nala odgrywa rolę postaci wspierającej.
examples.context: Adjective must agree with feminine noun 'postaci'.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Missing or incorrect prepositions and collocations
top_error_patterns.description: Omission or misuse of prepositions and collocations, leading to less natural or ambiguous phrasing.

examples.wrong: 13 rang (As do Króla)
examples.correct: 13 rang (od Asa do Króla)
examples.context: Card game terminology; missing preposition for range.

examples.wrong: Stwórz przewidywanie
examples.correct: Sformułuj przewidywanie
examples.context: Scientific method; correct collocation for hypothesis formulation.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of less idiomatic or incorrect relative pronouns, affecting sentence flow and clarity.

examples.wrong: rodzaj informacji, które zmienna może przechowywać
examples.correct: rodzaj informacji, jakie zmienna może przechowywać

examples.wrong: rodzaj informacji przechowywanych przez zmienne
examples.correct: rodzaj informacji, które są przechowywane przez zmienne

top_error_patterns.description: Mistakes in pronoun or number agreement, which can cause confusion about the subject or object.

examples.wrong: mierz ich wzrost przez tydzień
examples.correct: mierz jej wzrost przez tydzień
examples.context: Experiment instructions; pronoun should match singular subject.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of literal translations, anglicisms, or awkward phrasing instead of idiomatic French, which can reduce clarity and naturalness.

examples.wrong: Opérations d'entrée/sortie de base
examples.correct: Opérations d'entrée/sortie basiques

examples.wrong: Exprimez-vous clairement : Utilisez des phrases en "je"
examples.correct: Exprimez-vous clairement : Utilisez des phrases commençant par "je"

examples.wrong: Une barre rigide pivotant sur un point fixe (fulcrum)
examples.correct: Une barre rigide pivotant sur un point fixe (point d'appui)

top_error_patterns.description: Systematic misuse of words or expressions that do not fit idiomatic or standard French, leading to awkward or unclear phrasing.

examples.wrong: Application réelle : Calculateur basique
examples.correct: Application réelle : Calculatrice basique
examples.context: Confusion between technical and everyday terms for devices.

examples.wrong: Les énergies renouvelables sont inconsistantes.
examples.correct: Les énergies renouvelables sont intermittentes.

examples.wrong: le Président la veto
examples.correct: le Président y oppose son veto
examples.context: Incorrect use of 'veto' as a verb instead of a noun.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Omission or incorrect use of articles
top_error_patterns.description: Articles (definite, indefinite, partitive) are frequently omitted or incorrectly used, especially in lists and parallel structures, affecting idiomaticity and clarity.

examples.wrong: Dumplings et gâteaux de riz pendant le Nouvel An lunaire
examples.correct: Des dumplings et des gâteaux de riz pendant le Nouvel An lunaire
examples.context: List of foods for cultural events

examples.wrong: Feijoada et fruits tropicaux pendant le Carnaval
examples.correct: De la feijoada et des fruits tropicaux pendant le Carnaval
examples.context: List of foods for cultural events

examples.wrong: Cela signifie croire que vos capacités et votre intelligence peuvent croître grâce à l'effort, la pratique et la persévérance.
examples.correct: Cela signifie croire que vos capacités et votre intelligence peuvent croître grâce à l'effort, à la pratique et à la persévérance.

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent errors in article gender, agreement, or preposition selection, which affect grammatical correctness and clarity.

examples.wrong: grâce à la calme, l'écoute et les compromis
examples.correct: grâce au calme, à l'écoute et aux compromis
examples.context: Misuse of articles and prepositions with abstract nouns.

examples.wrong: pour un planète plus verte
examples.correct: pour une planète plus verte

examples.wrong: Il se réveilla en peur,
examples.correct: Il se réveilla de peur,

top_error_patterns.description: Recurring issues with word order, inversion, or phrasing that result in sentences that are difficult to understand or unidiomatic.

examples.wrong: Comment cette décision affectera-t-elle vous et les autres ?
examples.correct: Comment cette décision vous affectera-t-elle, vous et les autres ?

examples.wrong: De petits choix comme ce que manger au petit déjeuner, à des décisions plus importantes comme choisir une activité après l'école.
examples.correct: De petits choix comme ce que vous mangez au petit déjeuner, à des décisions plus importantes comme choisir une activité après l'école.

examples.wrong: La panique rend les décisions sûres plus difficiles.
examples.correct: La panique rend la prise de décisions sûres plus difficile.
examples.context: Unclear phrasing due to missing nominalization.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Missing or incorrect prepositions in parallel structures
top_error_patterns.description: Prepositions are sometimes omitted or not repeated in parallel structures, which can affect grammatical correctness and clarity.

examples.wrong: dans des fresques et sculptures
examples.correct: dans des fresques et des sculptures

examples.wrong: qui correspondent à vos objectifs et vos valeurs.
examples.correct: qui correspondent à vos objectifs et à vos valeurs.

top_error_patterns.description: English terms such as 'mindset' are used instead of more idiomatic French equivalents, which can affect professional tone and localization fit.

examples.wrong: Le mindset de croissance
examples.correct: L'état d'esprit de croissance

examples.wrong: Cela s'oppose au *mindset fixe*
examples.correct: Cela s'oppose à l'état d'esprit fixe

top_error_patterns.description: Use of words or phrases that are uncommon, awkward, or not standard in Russian, affecting clarity and naturalness.

examples.wrong: Дома с открытой вентиляцией для охлаждения.
examples.correct: Дома с открытой вентиляцией для проветривания и охлаждения.

examples.wrong: Предотвращает повреждение отношений.
examples.correct: Предотвращает разрушение отношений.

examples.wrong: Совместно придумывайте решения:
examples.correct: Совместно находите решения:

examples.wrong: ледерхозен и дирндли
examples.correct: ледерхозены и дирндли

examples.wrong: пан де муэрто
examples.correct: пан де муэртo

examples.wrong: Это значит представить себе, как кто-то может чувствовать себя в ситуации, и реагировать с заботой.
examples.correct: Это значит представить себе, как кто-то может чувствовать себя в такой ситуации, и реагировать с заботой.

examples.wrong: Поворачивая винт, вы позволяете ему глубже войти в объект или надежно его закрепить.
examples.correct: Поворачивая винт, вы позволяете ему глубже входить в объект или надежно закрепляться.

examples.wrong: Частицы расположены свободно и могут перемещаться друг мимо друга.
examples.correct: Частицы расположены свободно и могут перемещаться мимо друг друга.

examples.wrong: Учебные навыки — это набор стратегий и методов, которые помогают учащимся эффективно запоминать и применять информацию.
examples.correct: Учебные навыки — это совокупность стратегий и методов, которые помогают учащимся эффективно запоминать и применять информацию.

examples.wrong: Записи служат персональным ресурсом для повторения материала.
examples.correct: Записи служат личным ресурсом для повторения материала.

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent mistakes in case agreement, especially with instrumental and genitive forms, leading to awkward or incorrect phrasing.

examples.wrong: специализированная одежда для сохранения тепла
examples.correct: специализированной одеждой для сохранения тепла
examples.context: Instrumental case required after 'с' for correct meaning.

examples.wrong: одного переменного
examples.correct: одной переменной
examples.context: Gender and case agreement error in scientific context.

examples.wrong: уникальными происхождением
examples.correct: уникальным происхождением
examples.context: Instrumental case agreement with singular noun.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of words or phrases that are not idiomatic in Russian, reducing clarity and naturalness.

examples.wrong: нажимаете клин в объект
examples.correct: вдавливаете клин в объект
examples.context: Non-idiomatic verb choice for describing physical action.

examples.wrong: высокой энергозатраты
examples.correct: высоких энергозатрат
examples.context: Incorrect collocation and case for describing energy expenditure.

top_error_patterns.description: Definitions or explanations use repetitive or ambiguous wording, reducing clarity for learners.

examples.wrong: ограничения: ограничения или ограничения
examples.correct: ограничения: условия или рамки
examples.context: Redundant repetition in definition; needs synonyms for clarity.

examples.wrong: знаменатель — их количество
examples.correct: знаменатель — на сколько частей разделено целое

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect preposition usage before consonant clusters
top_error_patterns.description: Preposition 'с' used instead of 'со' before words starting with consonant clusters, which disrupts natural flow and correctness.

examples.wrong: Физические адаптации часто видны и непосредственно связаны с средой обитания.
examples.correct: Физические адаптации часто видны и непосредственно связаны со средой обитания.

examples.wrong: Связь с стандартом NGSS (MS-ETS1-1)
examples.correct: Связь со стандартом NGSS (MS-ETS1-1)

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Punctuation errors with introductory words and quotation marks
top_error_patterns.description: Missing commas after introductory words like 'например' and incorrect placement of periods with quotation marks, which affects readability and adherence to Russian punctuation norms.

examples.wrong: например вирусы или шпионские программы
examples.correct: например, вирусы или шпионские программы

examples.wrong: например "password" или "123456"
examples.correct: например, "password" или "123456"

examples.wrong: Кивайте или отвечайте короткими фразами, такими как "Я понимаю" или "Это имеет смысл."
examples.correct: Кивайте или отвечайте короткими фразами, такими как "Я понимаю" или "Это имеет смысл".

top_error_patterns.description: Misspellings such as unnecessary accent marks or incorrect use of 'е' instead of 'ё', which slightly affect professionalism.

examples.wrong: разбира́ться в книгах и текстах, которые вы читаете.
examples.correct: разбираться в книгах и текстах, которые вы читаете.

examples.wrong: — это мощный инструмент, который помогает убедить аудиторию в определенной точке зрения или действиях.
examples.correct: — это мощный инструмент, который помогает убедить аудиторию в определённой точке зрения или действиях.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Unnecessary or incorrect use of 'это' after dash
top_error_patterns.description: Redundant use of 'это' after dash in definitions, which is not standard in Russian and affects sentence conciseness.

examples.wrong: Этос, пафос и логос — это основные инструменты для создания убедительных аргументов.
examples.correct: Этос, пафос и логос — основные инструменты для создания убедительных аргументов.

top_error_patterns.description: Compound nouns are frequently written as separate words or with incorrect hyphenation, which violates German orthographic rules and affects readability.

examples.wrong: Symbolschrift-System
examples.correct: Symbolschriftsystem

examples.wrong: Hauptklimazonen Merkmale
examples.correct: Hauptklimazonenmerkmale

examples.wrong: Mikrogravitations-Effekte
examples.correct: Mikrogravitationseffekte

examples.wrong: Feuersicherheitszusammenfassung
examples.correct: Feuersicherheits-Zusammenfassung

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Missing definite articles in noun phrases
top_error_patterns.description: Definite articles are often omitted in noun phrases, leading to unidiomatic and sometimes ambiguous expressions in German.

examples.wrong: Definition Empathie
examples.correct: Definition der Empathie

examples.wrong: Vorteile Selbstwahrnehmung
examples.correct: Vorteile der Selbstwahrnehmung

examples.wrong: Hauptkomponenten EI
examples.correct: Hauptkomponenten der EI

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent misspellings and incorrect word formations, including use of non-standard or untranslated terms, which can hinder comprehension and professional tone.

examples.wrong: Kaktuszaunkönigin
examples.correct: Kaktuszaunkönig

examples.wrong: Poetry ist eine besondere Form der Literatur...
examples.correct: Poesie ist eine besondere Form der Literatur...

examples.wrong: Behaltensleistung
examples.correct: Behaltensvermögen

examples.wrong: Internationalen Pakt über bürgerliche und politische Rechte...
examples.correct: Internationaler Pakt über bürgerliche und politische Rechte...
examples.context: Incorrect case in official document names

top_error_patterns.description: Omission or incorrect use of definite articles and grammatical cases, especially with nouns and set phrases, affecting clarity and correctness.

examples.wrong: Wichtigkeit von Erste Hilfe
examples.correct: Wichtigkeit der Ersten Hilfe
examples.context: Missing definite article and incorrect case

examples.wrong: Ursprung in europäischen Traditionen, entwickelt während Mittelalter, Renaissance...
examples.correct: Ursprung in europäischen Traditionen, entwickelt sich während des Mittelalters, der Renaissance...
examples.context: Missing articles and incorrect case for historical periods

examples.wrong: Kulturelle Feierlichkeiten sind entscheidend für die Ausdruck...
examples.correct: Kulturelle Feierlichkeiten sind entscheidend für den Ausdruck...

top_error_patterns.description: Mistakes in gender and number agreement between articles, adjectives, and nouns, leading to grammatical inaccuracies.

examples.wrong: Sicherheit für Helfer und Verletzten gewährleisten.
examples.correct: Sicherheit für Helfer und Verletzte gewährleisten.

examples.wrong: dass keine Zweig zu mächtig wird.
examples.correct: dass kein Zweig zu mächtig wird.

examples.wrong: In der Landwirtschaft wird durch genetische Modifikation resistentere Ernte erzeugt.
examples.correct: In der Landwirtschaft werden durch genetische Modifikation resistentere Ernten erzeugt.
examples.context: Number agreement between verb and noun

top_error_patterns.description: Wrong gender article used with abbreviations, especially scientific terms, which can reduce professional tone.

examples.wrong: das DNA
examples.correct: die DNA

top_error_patterns.description: Non-idiomatic or awkward word choices reduce clarity and naturalness of the German text.

examples.wrong: wie wir es sicher verhindern
examples.correct: wie wir es sicher vermeiden

examples.wrong: Bemühen wertschätzen und schätzen.
examples.correct: Bemühen wertschätzen und anerkennen.

examples.wrong: Geneigte Ebenen reduzieren den Kraftaufwand beim Heben von Objekten.
examples.correct: Geneigte Ebenen reduzieren den Kraftaufwand beim Heben von Gegenständen.

top_error_patterns.description: Words are incorrectly capitalized in the middle of sentences, which disrupts the flow and violates German capitalization rules.

examples.wrong: Der träumte, er esse seinen Schuh.
examples.correct: der träumte, er esse seinen Schuh.

examples.wrong: Mitten in der Nacht, Um zu sehen, dass sein Traum wahr wurde.
examples.correct: mitten in der Nacht, um zu sehen, dass sein Traum wahr wurde.

top_error_patterns.description: Conjunctions or prepositions are omitted, resulting in incomplete or grammatically incorrect sentences.

examples.wrong: Entstand in den 1950er Jahren, mischte Elemente von Blues, Country und Rhythm & Blues.
examples.correct: Entstand in den 1950er Jahren und mischte Elemente von Blues, Country und Rhythm & Blues.

examples.wrong: Entwickelte sich Mitte des 20. Jahrhunderts als kommerzielles Genre.
examples.correct: Entwickelte sich Mitte des 20. Jahrhunderts zu einem kommerziellen Genre.

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent use of non-idiomatic, incorrect, or non-standard words and expressions that reduce clarity and naturalness in Portuguese.

examples.wrong: Representação aumentada de afro-americanos em governo, educação e mídia.
examples.correct: Aumento da representação de afro-americanos no governo, na educação e na mídia.
examples.context: Awkward phrasing and incorrect preposition usage.

examples.wrong: Como ele é expressado?
examples.correct: Como ele é expresso?

examples.wrong: Encargado de criar e aprovar leis.
examples.correct: Responsável por criar e aprovar leis.

examples.wrong: Construindo Argumentos Convincente com Ethos, Pathos e Logos
examples.correct: Construindo Argumentos Convincentes com Ethos, Pathos e Logos

examples.wrong: Comprando cartas com objetivos específicos.
examples.correct: Comprando cartas com objetivos específicos.
examples.context: Incorrect verb for card games; should be 'comprando' (drawing) not 'comprando' (buying).

top_error_patterns.description: Omission of definite articles ('a', 'o', 'as', 'os', 'das') before nouns and noun phrases, leading to unnatural or incomplete phrasing in Portuguese.

examples.wrong: importância das habilidades de estudo
examples.correct: A importância das habilidades de estudo
examples.context: Phrase opening missing the definite article

examples.wrong: resumo habilidades de estudo
examples.correct: resumo das habilidades de estudo
examples.context: Noun phrase missing article for clarity

examples.wrong: oferecem perspectivas diversificadas sobre vida, espiritualidade e ética.
examples.correct: oferecem perspectivas diversificadas sobre a vida, a espiritualidade e a ética.
examples.context: List of abstract nouns missing articles

top_error_patterns.description: Use of unnatural or awkward expressions that do not align with idiomatic Portuguese, affecting fluency and clarity.

examples.wrong: A localização do Egito conectava-o a outras regiões
examples.correct: A localização do Egito o conectava a outras regiões

examples.wrong: Testes avaliam o quão bem o protótipo resolve o problema.
examples.correct: Testes avaliam o quanto o protótipo resolve o problema.

examples.wrong: Evite compartilhar excessivamente
examples.correct: Evite compartilhar em excesso

top_error_patterns.description: Direct translation of English syntax or pronouns, leading to unnatural or incorrect Portuguese sentence structure.

examples.wrong: Os alimentos são mais do que algo que consumimos—they são o combustível para todos os processos do nosso corpo.
examples.correct: Os alimentos são mais do que algo que consumimos — eles são o combustível para todos os processos do nosso corpo.
examples.context: Use of English 'they' and missing space before dash.

top_error_patterns.description: Incorrect spelling or missing hyphenation in compound adjectives and proper nouns, which can affect professionalism and correctness.

examples.wrong: feedbacks
examples.correct: retornos
examples.context: Use of English word instead of Portuguese equivalent

examples.wrong: Eventos Chave Relacionados aos Direitos Humanos
examples.correct: Eventos-chave Relacionados aos Direitos Humanos

examples.wrong: O tema de *O Sol é para Todos*
examples.correct: O tema de *O Sol é Para Todos*

top_error_patterns.description: Half-width colon ':' is used instead of the standard full-width '：' in Japanese, especially after '例'.

examples.wrong: 例: 太陽光は電力を生成するために利用される。
examples.correct: 例：太陽光は電力を生成するために利用される。

examples.wrong: 例: 水は農業の灌漑や家庭での飲料水として使用される。
examples.correct: 例：水は農業の灌漑や家庭での飲料水として使用される。

top_error_patterns.description: Repeated misuse of '門' instead of the correct '部' or omission of '部' when referring to government branches, leading to unnatural or incorrect expressions.

examples.wrong: 行政府門の役割
examples.correct: 行政府の役割
examples.context: Government context; quiz item describing executive branch roles.

examples.wrong: 行政府門
examples.correct: 行政府
examples.context: Government context; label for executive branch.

examples.wrong: 行政府門: 法律に拒否権を行使し、裁判官を任命する権限を持つ。
examples.correct: 行政府: 法律に拒否権を行使し、裁判官を任命する権限を持つ。
examples.context: Government context; description of executive branch powers.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of unnatural or incorrect terms that reduce clarity and naturalness in Japanese, especially in scientific and mathematical contexts.

examples.wrong: DNAは4つの化学塩基（アデニン、チミン、シトシン、グアニン）で構成される言語で遺伝情報を記録します。
examples.correct: DNAは4つの化学塩基（アデニン、チミン、シトシン、グアニン）によって遺伝情報が記録されています。
examples.context: Science context; explanation of DNA structure and function.

examples.wrong: 円の端のすべての点は中心から同じ距離にあります。
examples.correct: 円周上のすべての点は中心から同じ距離にあります。
examples.context: Math context; description of points on a circle.

examples.wrong: 音節パターンは5-7-5。
examples.correct: 音数パターンは5-7-5。
examples.context: Literature context; explanation of haiku structure.

top_error_patterns.description: Phrases like '円の形をしています' and '三角形の形をしています' are used instead of the more natural '円形をしています' or '三角形をしています'.

examples.wrong: ピザや時計は円の形をしています！
examples.correct: ピザや時計は円形をしています！

examples.wrong: 家の屋根はしばしば三角形の形をしています。
examples.correct: 家の屋根はしばしば三角形をしています。

top_error_patterns.description: Incorrect spelling of loanwords, leading to confusion or lack of recognition by native speakers.

examples.wrong: サイバーブリング
examples.correct: サイバーブリーイング
examples.context: Social studies context; reference to cyberbullying.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of awkward or ambiguous terms instead of standard Japanese expressions.

examples.wrong: 無火のロウソク
examples.correct: 電池式のロウソク

examples.wrong: 煙探知機全体は10年ごとに交換する。
examples.correct: 煙探知機は10年ごとに本体を交換する。

top_error_patterns.description: Verbs are connected unnaturally, e.g., '理解して実行できる' instead of '理解し実行できる'.

examples.wrong: プログラミングは、コンピューターが理解して実行できる指示を作成することです。
examples.correct: プログラミングは、コンピューターが理解し実行できる指示を作成することです。

examples.wrong: 円は角や辺のない丸い形です。
examples.correct: 円は角や辺がない丸い形です。

top_error_patterns.description: English-style comma ',' is used instead of full-width Japanese '、' in lists.

examples.wrong: 第1,2,5行は長く韻を踏み、第3,4行は短く韻を踏みます。
examples.correct: 第1、2、5行は長く韻を踏み、第3、4行は短く韻を踏みます。
examples.context: Listing line numbers in poetry explanation

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect Word Choice for Technical Terms
top_error_patterns.description: Misuse or inaccurate selection of words for scientific or technical concepts, leading to confusion or misrepresentation of meaning.

examples.wrong: Variables in algebra can be letters or symbols, and sometimes numbers.
examples.correct: Variables in algebra can be letters or symbols, but not numbers.
examples.context: Algebraic terminology; numbers are constants, not variables.

examples.wrong: Variables in algebra can be represented by letters, numbers, or symbols, depending on the context and the preference of the mathematician.
examples.correct: Variables in algebra can be represented by letters or symbols, depending on the context and the preference of the mathematician.
examples.context: Algebraic terminology; numbers are not used to represent variables.

examples.wrong: Random guesses, known as 'hypotheses,' are actually well-considered, testable predictions that are opposite to what is expected.
examples.correct: Hypotheses are not random guesses; they are well-considered, testable predictions based on prior knowledge and observation.
examples.context: Scientific terminology; hypotheses are not random guesses.

examples.wrong: that are opposite to what is expected
examples.correct: that are based on what is expected
examples.context: Scientific terminology; hypotheses are not necessarily the opposite of expectations.

examples.wrong: In solids, particles vibrate but maintain a fixed volume.
examples.correct: In solids, particles vibrate but maintain a fixed shape and volume.
examples.context: Physics terminology; solids have both fixed shape and volume.

top_error_patterns.description: Explanations use incorrect terminology or make inaccurate claims about programming language behavior, leading to confusion and misunderstanding.

examples.wrong: Attempting to assign a string to 'temperature' would result in a TypeError since Python is trying to interpret 'Hello' as a numerical value.
examples.correct: Assigning a string to 'temperature' does not result in a TypeError, because Python does not enforce variable types.
examples.context: Explanation of variable assignment in Python

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent use of imprecise, ambiguous, or awkward words and phrases that reduce clarity or professionalism. Includes incorrect terminology, ambiguous references, and nonstandard collocations.

examples.wrong: less nine
examples.correct: minus nine

examples.wrong: Mitochondria are solely responsible for breaking down glucose into ATP.
examples.correct: Mitochondria are solely responsible for converting glucose into ATP.

examples.wrong: Plasma, unlike solids, is not denser but rather less dense than gases, as it is a highly energized ionized state.
examples.correct: Plasma, unlike solids, is not denser but rather less dense than gases, as it is a highly energetic ionized state.
examples.context: Physics content describing states of matter

top_error_patterns.description: Systematic misuse of prepositions or collocations, leading to unnatural or incorrect phrasing.

examples.wrong: adept in understanding and managing their own emotions
examples.correct: adept at understanding and managing their own emotions

examples.wrong: technique of creating patterns with dots
examples.correct: technique for creating patterns with dots

examples.wrong: may introduce bacteria to the wound
examples.correct: may introduce bacteria into the wound

top_error_patterns.description: Use of vague or ambiguous references that reduce clarity, such as unclear pronouns or indirect phrasing.

examples.wrong: The celebration you're referring to involves families preparing special altars...
examples.correct: During Día de los Muertos, families prepare special altars...

examples.wrong: highlighting systemic inequality.
examples.correct: which highlighted systemic inequality.

top_error_patterns.description: Mistakes in matching singular or plural subjects with the correct verb forms, reducing clarity and professionalism.

examples.wrong: Each of these categories represent a different food group, illustrating the variety of nutrients provided by our diet.
examples.correct: Each of these categories represents a different food group, illustrating the variety of nutrients provided by our diet.

examples.wrong: Changing passwords frequently and not reusing them across various accounts is a recommended security practice to protect against unauthorized access, as it complicates potential hackers' efforts to gain entry.
examples.correct: Changing passwords frequently and not reusing them across various accounts are recommended security practices to protect against unauthorized access, as they complicate potential hackers' efforts to gain entry.
examples.context: Compound plural subject requires plural verb and pronoun.

top_error_patterns.description: Use of phrasing that is confusing or lacks clarity, making comprehension difficult for readers.

examples.wrong: In DNA, the sequence of nitrogenous bases can be read in a direction only.
examples.correct: In DNA, the sequence of nitrogenous bases can be read in only one direction.
examples.context: Scientific explanation; original phrasing is awkward and unclear.

top_error_patterns.description: Statements that contain internal contradictions or confusing logic, reducing clarity and accuracy.

examples.wrong: The adoption of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights occurred in the aftermath of World War II, not after its end.
examples.correct: The adoption of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights occurred after the end of World War II, not during the war.
examples.context: Historical context; 'aftermath' means after the end, so the original is contradictory.

top_error_patterns.description: Omission or misuse of definite or indefinite articles, which can affect clarity and correctness.

examples.wrong: Choosing a new office location should prioritize cost over the proximity to public transportation.
examples.correct: Choosing a new office location should prioritize cost over proximity to public transportation.

examples.wrong: altering the magnitude or direction of force applied
examples.correct: altering the magnitude or direction of the force applied

top_error_patterns.description: Unnecessary capitalization of common nouns such as 'haiku' and 'limerick' when not at the start of a sentence.

examples.wrong: A Haiku, as mentioned, is a traditional Japanese poem...
examples.correct: A haiku, as mentioned, is a traditional Japanese poem...

examples.wrong: A Limerick consists of five lines...
examples.correct: A limerick consists of five lines...

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect Lexical Choice for Key Terms
top_error_patterns.description: Misuse of key terms or phrases leads to confusion and misrepresentation of important concepts, especially when referencing well-known speeches or ideas.

examples.wrong: como su famosa 'Son de Reverde'
examples.correct: como su famoso 'Sueño de Rev. King'
examples.context: Reference to Martin Luther King Jr.'s 'I Have a Dream' speech; incorrect phrase used.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Severe Spelling Errors in Core Vocabulary
top_error_patterns.description: Major spelling mistakes in basic words reduce clarity and professionalism, making content harder to understand and less credible.

examples.wrong: individuicios
examples.correct: individuos
examples.context: Misspelling of a common noun in quiz content.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect Word Choice and False Friends
top_error_patterns.description: Frequent use of literal translations, anglicisms, or non-standard terms that do not fit Spanish context, leading to confusion or lack of clarity.

examples.wrong: el Sphinx
examples.correct: la Esfinge
examples.context: Use of English term instead of Spanish equivalent.

examples.wrong: cheques y balances
examples.correct: pesos y contrapesos
examples.context: Literal translation of English phrase; Spanish uses a different idiomatic expression.

examples.wrong: substractar
examples.correct: restar
examples.context: Non-existent verb in Spanish; false friend from English.

top_error_patterns.description: Systematic mismatches between noun and article/adjective gender, affecting clarity and grammatical correctness.

examples.wrong: el clorofila
examples.correct: la clorofila

examples.wrong: las sentimientos
examples.correct: los sentimientos

examples.wrong: cuestiones éticos
examples.correct: cuestiones éticas
examples.context: Adjective does not agree in gender with noun.

top_error_patterns.description: Frequent misspellings, incorrect accentuation, and use of non-existent words, reducing professionalism and clarity.

examples.wrong: riesgons
examples.correct: riesgos

examples.wrong: mnemonics
examples.correct: mnemónicos
examples.context: English spelling used instead of Spanish.

examples.wrong: compromitérsela
examples.correct: comprometerla
examples.context: Incorrect accent mark and verb form.

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect word choice for idiomatic or precise Spanish
top_error_patterns.description: Use of words that are technically correct but less idiomatic or precise in Spanish, affecting naturalness and clarity.

examples.wrong: gran variedad de tipos de alimentos
examples.correct: amplia variedad de tipos de alimentos

examples.wrong: productos lácteos
examples.correct: lácteos

examples.wrong: mezcla rica en nutrientes esenciales
examples.correct: combinación rica en nutrientes esenciales

examples.wrong: reabastecer naturalmente
examples.correct: renovar naturalmente

examples.wrong: entornos seguros y confiados
examples.correct: entornos seguros y de confianza

examples.wrong: mediante sus conocimientos, experiencias y ética
examples.correct: a través de sus conocimientos, experiencia y ética

examples.wrong: no únicamente en la presentación de datos
examples.correct: no solo en la presentación de datos

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Missing or incorrect use of definite/indefinite articles
top_error_patterns.description: Omission or misuse of articles ('la', 'una', 'los', 'las') leads to unnatural or grammatically incorrect sentences.

examples.wrong: No ficción está destinada a informar...
examples.correct: La no ficción está destinada a informar...

examples.wrong: nutrición equilibrada incluye una variedad...
examples.correct: una nutrición equilibrada incluye una variedad...

examples.wrong: Acrónimos ayudan a simplificar...
examples.correct: Los acrónimos ayudan a simplificar...

examples.wrong: A diferencia de los carbohidratos, proteínas o grasas...
examples.correct: A diferencia de los carbohidratos, las proteínas o las grasas...

examples.wrong: aunque esto puede ser una parte de la asistencia avanzada
examples.correct: aunque esto puede ser parte de la asistencia avanzada

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Numerical fractions not written out in words
top_error_patterns.description: Numerical fractions (e.g., 1/4, 2/4) are presented as digits instead of being written out in words, which is preferred for clarity in educational Spanish.

examples.wrong: específicamente 1/4
examples.correct: específicamente un cuarto
examples.context: Explaining fractions in math or food examples

examples.wrong: 4/8, que se simplifica a 1/2
examples.correct: cuatro octavos, que se simplifica a un medio

examples.wrong: La fracción que representa la parte comida es **7/12**
examples.correct: La fracción que representa la parte comida es siete doceavos

examples.wrong: la fracción 2/4
examples.correct: la fracción dos cuartos

top_error_patterns.description: Mismatch between subject and verb number, leading to grammatical errors and reduced clarity.

examples.wrong: La función la realiza principalmente las mitocondrias
examples.correct: La función la realizan principalmente las mitocondrias

examples.wrong: se establecen conexiones... y las recuerdos
examples.correct: se establecen conexiones... y los recuerdos

top_error_patterns.pattern_name: Incorrect Use of Articles and Prepositions
top_error_patterns.description: Omission or misuse of articles and prepositions, resulting in awkward or unclear phrasing.

examples.wrong: lo cual es esencial para la camuflaje
examples.correct: lo cual es esencial para el camuflaje

examples.wrong: a la siguiente lanzamiento
examples.correct: al siguiente lanzamiento

top_error_patterns.description: Sentences contain unnecessary repetition or awkward constructions that reduce conciseness and clarity.

examples.wrong: las constantes representan valores que permanecen invariables y no varían
examples.correct: las constantes representan valores que permanecen invariables y no cambian

examples.wrong: una parte esencial de una dieta equilibrada
examples.correct: esenciales en una dieta equilibrada

examples.wrong: El uso de hielo directo
examples.correct: El uso de hielo directamente

examples.wrong: El agua es, de hecho, esencial para la vida
examples.correct: El agua es esencial para la vida

top_error_patterns.description: Misspellings and incorrect punctuation, such as missing accents or improper use of periods with abbreviations and question marks.

examples.wrong: La bondad solo beneficia a la persona que la práctica.
examples.correct: La bondad solo beneficia a la persona que la practica.

examples.wrong: mnemonicos
examples.correct: mnemónicos

examples.wrong: EE.UU, independientemente de su edad...
examples.correct: EE.UU., independientemente de su edad...

top_error_patterns.description: Recurring issues with word order, incomplete phrases, and awkward constructions that obscure meaning and reduce clarity.

examples.wrong: aby stworzyć smaczną.
examples.correct: aby stworzyć smaczny posiłek.

examples.wrong: Ten wzór trwa w dół okresu i tylko odzwierciedla się w dół grup, gdzie wznoszą się elementy z większą elektroujemnością.
